any.description: Can be anything (text, int, bool, json, html, etc.)
any.example: This is a content of any type !

iam.ResourceMetadata.description: IAM resource metadata embedded in services models

displayName.description: Resource display name

tags.description: Resource tags. Tags that were internally computed are prefixed with ovh:

urn.description: Unique resource name used in policies

operator.description: Operator to use in order to filter on the value (defaults to 'EQ')

value.description: Value to use in order to filter tags

iam.resource.TagFilter.OperatorEnum.description: Operator that can be used in order to filter resources tags

ipLoadbalancing.BackendProbe.description: Probe used to determine if a backend is alive and can handle requests

forceSsl.description: Force probe to run over a SSL layer. Defaults to false

interval.description: Seconds between each probe check. Must be > 30sec. Defaults to 30

match.description: Matcher to use to valide "expect". "default" uses HAProxy's default behavior for this type of check. "status" is only supported for HTTP probes

method.description: HTTP method to use with "http" probe. Consider using HEAD to save bandwidth when possible. Defaults to "GET"

pattern.description: Server response expected when UP. Empty for "default", comma delimited list of statuses for "status", string for "contains", regex for "matches"

port.description: Port used to probe your backend. Equal to farm port if null. Ignored for oco probe type

url.description: URL to use for HTTP probes of the form [www.example.com]/path/to/check. Protocol will be ignored. Defaults to "/"

ipLoadbalancing.BalanceHTTPEnum.description: Possible values for load balancing balance algorithm

ipLoadbalancing.BalanceTCPEnum.description: Possible values for load balancing balance algorithm

ipLoadbalancing.DefinedFarm.description: a list of { type => [ Farm ids ] }

ipLoadbalancing.DefinedRoute.description: Defined routes name, type and id. Typically used to generate autocomplete lists.

displayName.description: Human readable name for your route

matches.description: List of possible probe result checkers for this type of probe

method.description: List of available HTTP method, if available

negatableMatches.description: List of matches operators that accept the negate option for this type of probe

port.description: True is this probe type supports a custom port

type.description: Probe protocol name. See probe "type" field in the farm probe

url.description: True is this probe type supports a URL

allowedSource.description: Restrict iplb access to these ip block. No restriction if null. You cannot specify allowedSource and deniedSource both at the same time

dedicatedIpfo.description: Only attach frontend on these ip. No restriction if null

defaultSslId.description: Default ssl served to your customer

deniedSource.description: Deny iplb access to these ip block. No restriction if null. You cannot specify allowedSource and deniedSource both at the same time

httpHeader.description: Add header to your frontend. Useful variables admitted : %ci <=> client_ip, %cp <=> client_port

port.description: Port(s) attached to your frontend

ipLoadbalancing.InstancesState.description: A structure describing the current state of an IPLB instances

internalId.description: Internal ID of this IPLB instance

state.description: Current state of this IPLB instance

displayName.description: Set the name displayed in ManagerV6 for your iplb (max 50 chars)

ipv4.description: The IPV4 associated to your IP load balancing

ipv6.description: The IPV6 associated to your IP load balancing

metricsToken.description: The metrics token associated with your IP load balancing

offer.description: The offer of your IP load balancing

orderableZone.description: Available additional zone for your Load Balancer

serviceName.description: The internal name of your IP load balancing

additionalReturnedFields.description: List of additional log fields managed in this log kind

createdAt.description: Creation date of the log kind

displayName.description: Log kind display name

updatedAt.description: Last update date of the log kind

kind.description: Log kind name of this subscription

resource.description: Subscribed resource, where the logs come from

serviceName.description: Name of the destination log service

streamId.description: Id of the destination log stream

updatedAt.description: Last update date of the subscription

ipLoadbalancing.LogSubscriptionResponse.description: Logs subscription response for your Load Balancer

operationId.description: The operation id of the subscription creation task

ipLoadbalancing.OrderableZone.description: Available additional zone to order for a Load Balancer

planCode.description: The billing planCode for this zone

ipLoadbalancing.PendingChanges.description: The pending changes for a Load Balancer zone

number.description: The number of changes waiting to be applied

zone.description: The Load Balancer zone with pending changes

ipLoadbalancing.ProbeExpectMatchEnum.description: List of possible probe result matches. "status" is only supported for HTTP probes

ipLoadbalancing.ProbeMethodEnum.description: List of possible method for HTTP probes. Consider using HEAD to save bandwidth when possible.

ipLoadbalancing.Quota.Quota.description: Quota informations for current billing period for this zone

alert.description: Quota alert value in bytes. When reached, we will send you an alert. Default : included quota with your offer

included.description: Included quota value with your offer, in bytes

lastUpdateDate.description: The last time your quota was updated from your Load Balancer instance

resetDate.description: The last time your quota was resetted (billed)

total.description: Total used quota value in bytes

historizedDate.description: Historized date for this quota entry

lastUpdateDate.description: The last time your quota was updated from your Load Balancer instance

resetDate.description: The last time your quota was resetted (billed)

total.description: Total used quota value in bytes

destination.description: Type of the destination for this action

status.description: List of available HTTP status code if applicable

ipLoadbalancing.RouteAvailableRule.description: Match rule to combine to build routes

enum.description: If pattern is "enum", list of available options

hasSubField.description: If true, this rule needs a subfield. Typically a cookie or header name

matches.description: List of match operators compatible with this rule

pattern.description: Expected type for the pattern. Like "enum", "backend", "cidr", ...

action.description: Action triggered when all rules match

displayName.description: Human readable name for your route, this field is for you

rules.description: List of rules to match to trigger action

status.description: Route status. Routes in "ok" state are ready to operate

weight.description: Route priority ([0..255]). 0 if null. Highest priority routes are evaluated last. Only the first matching route will trigger an action

ipLoadbalancing.RouteHttpAction.description: Action triggered when all rules from route match

status.description: HTTP status code for "redirect" and "reject" actions

target.description: Farm ID for "farm" action type or URL template for "redirect" action. You may use ${uri}, ${protocol}, ${host}, ${port} and ${path} variables in redirect target

type.description: Action to trigger if all the rules of this route matches

ipLoadbalancing.RouteRule.description: Match rule to combine to build routes

field.description: Name of the field to match like "protocol" or "host". See "/ipLoadbalancing/{serviceName}/route/availableRules" for a list of available rules

match.description: Matching operator. Not all operators are available for all fields. See "/availableRules"

pattern.description: Value to match against this match. Interpretation if this field depends on the match and field

subField.description: Name of sub-field, if applicable. This may be a Cookie or Header name for instance

displayName.description: Human readable name for your rule

field.description: Name of the field to match like "protocol" or "host". See "/ipLoadbalancing/{serviceName}/availableRouteRules" for a list of available rules

match.description: Matching operator. Not all operators are available for all fields. See "/ipLoadbalancing/{serviceName}/availableRouteRules"

pattern.description: Value to match against this match. Interpretation if this field depends on the match and field

subField.description: Name of sub-field, if applicable. This may be a Cookie or Header name for instance

ipLoadbalancing.RouteRuleMatchesEnum.description: List of possible route rule matches

action.description: Action triggered when all rules match

displayName.description: Human readable name for your route, this field is for you

rules.description: List of rules to match to trigger action

status.description: Route status. Routes in "ok" state are ready to operate

weight.description: Route priority ([0..255]). 0 if null. Highest priority routes are evaluated last. Only the first matching route will trigger an action

ipLoadbalancing.RouteTcpAction.description: Action triggered when all rules from route match

target.description: Farm ID for "farm" action type, empty for others

type.description: Action to trigger if all the rules of this route matches

lastCheckContent.description: Last health check contents or textual error

displayName.description: Human readable name for your ssl certificate, this field is for you

expireDate.description: Expire date of your SSL certificate

san.description: Subject Alternative Name of your SSL certificate

serial.description: Serial of your SSL certificate (Deprecated, use fingerprint instead !)

type.description:
Type of your SSL certificate.
'built' for SSL certificates managed by the IP Load Balancing. 'custom' for user manager certificates.

farms.description: The Load Balancer farms status informations

frontends.description: The Load Balancer frontends status informations

servers.description: The Load Balancer servers status informations

service.description: The Load Balancer service status informations

ipLoadbalancing.StickinessHTTPEnum.description: Possible values for HTTP backend stickiness

ipLoadbalancing.StickinessTCPEnum.description: Possible values for TCP backend stickiness

zones.description: Zone of your Load Balancer which are updated by current Task

ipLoadbalancing.VrackInformation.description: Information about vRack for your Load Balancer

state.description: State of the vRack link to your Load Balancer

task.description: Ongoing task related to vRack installation or uninstallation on your Load Balancer

vrackName.description: Name of the vRack on which the current Load Balancer is attached to, as it is named on vRack product

ipLoadbalancing.VrackNetwork.VrackNetwor.description: Represents a private network in the vRack

displayName.description: Human readable name for your vrack network

farmId.description: Farm Id your vrack network is attached to and their type

natIp.description: An IP block used as a pool of IPs by this Load Balancer to connect to the servers in this private network. The block must be in the private network and reserved for the Load Balancer

subnet.description: IP block of the private network in the vRack

vlan.description: VLAN of the private network in the vRack. 0 if the private network is not in a VLAN

vrackNetworkId.description: Internal Load Balancer identifier of the vRack private network description

ipLoadbalancing.VrackNetworkCreationRule.description: Rules to create a new description of a private network in the vRack

minNatIps.description: Minimum number of IPs needed to forward requests to your servers using NAT in your private network behind the current Load Balancer. Ip Block given on Load Balancer vRack network must contain at least this number of IP.

remainingNetworks.description: Number of remaining private network descriptions available for creation for this Load Balancer

vrackName.description: Name of the vRack on which the current Load Balancer is attached to, as it is named on vRack product

ipLoadbalancing.VrackStateEnum.description: Possible values for load balancing vRack state

ipLoadbalancing.VrackTransparentGateways.description: Aims to help you configure needed transparent interfaces

port.description: Port attached to your farm. Inherited from frontend if null

probe.description: Probe used to determine if a backend is alive and can handle requests. Defaults to tcp on the same port as the farm

stickiness.description: Stickiness type. No stickiness if null

vrackNetworkId.description: Internal Load Balancer identifier of the vRack private network attached to your farm, mandatory when your Load Balancer is attached to a vRack

chain.description: Certificate chain. Allow server certificate verification (Avoid man-in-the-middle attacks)

cookie.description: Server cookie value configured for cookie stickiness

ssl.description: SSL ciphering. Probes will also be sent ciphered. Default: 'false'

weight.description: Weight value. Defaults to 1. 0 if not used in load balancing. Servers with higher weight get more requests.

post.summary: Add a server to a TCP Farm

parameters.name: farmId
parameters.description: Id of your farm

parameters.name: serviceName
parameters.description: The internal name of your IP load balancing

chain.description: Certificate chain. Allow server certificate verification (Avoid man-in-the-middle attacks)

displayName.description: Human readable name for your server, this field is for you

onMarkedDown.description: Enable action when backend marked down. (No action if null)

port.description: Port attached to your server ([1..49151]). Inherited from farm if null

proxyProtocolVersion.description: Disabled if null. Send PROXY protocol header. Requires a compatible server.

ssl.description: SSL ciphering. Probes will also be sent ciphered. Default: 'false'

weight.description: Set weight on that server [1..256]. 0 if not used in load balancing. 1 if left null. Servers with higher weight get more requests.

post.summary: Add a new TCP frontend on your IP Load Balancing

parameters.name: serviceName
parameters.description: The internal name of your IP load balancing

allowedSource.description: Restrict IP Load Balancing access to these ip block. No restriction if null. You cannot specify allowedSource and deniedSource both at the same time

dedicatedIpfo.description: Only attach frontend on these ip. No restriction if null

defaultFarmId.description: Default TCP Farm of your frontend

defaultSslId.description: Default ssl served to your customer

deniedSource.description: Deny IP Load Balancing access to these ip block. No restriction if null. You cannot specify allowedSource and deniedSource both at the same time

displayName.description: Human readable name for your frontend, this field is for you

port.description: Port(s) attached to your frontend. Supports single port (numerical value), range (2 dash-delimited increasing ports) and comma-separated list of 'single port' and/or 'range'. Each port must be in the [1;49151] range.

zone.description: Zone of your frontend. Use "all" for all owned zone.

parameters.description: Id of your frontend

displayName.description: Human readable name for your rule

field.description: Name of the field to match like "protocol" or "host". See "/ipLoadbalancing/{serviceName}/availableRouteRules" for a list of available rules

match.description: Matching operator. Not all operators are available for all fields. See "/ipLoadbalancing/{serviceName}/availableRouteRules"

pattern.description: Value to match against this match. Interpretation if this field depends on the match and field

subField.description: Name of sub-field, if applicable. This may be a Cookie or Header name for instance

subnet.description: IP Block of the private network in the vRack

vlan.description: VLAN of the private network in the vRack. 0 if the private network is not in a VLAN
